definition: to establish/to found/to set up/to build/to construct

sentences.english: The children build sandcastles on the beach.
So they used pinewood as the foundation.
sentences.chinese: 所以建房子的人就采用松木作为地基。

sentences.english: Running shoe built for the neutral to under-pronator who requires an enhanced cushioning.
sentences.chinese: 跑鞋建中立副旋者需要增加缓冲。

sentences.english: There Vulcan Peak Temple, built by the Ming dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 峰上有祝融殿，是明代所建。

sentences.english: We are going to build a building here.
sentences.chinese: 我们打算在这里建一座楼。

sentences.english: The bridge were built by stayers since Shanxi.
sentences.chinese: 这座桥是广东的务工佣人建的。

sentences.english: The library is too old . They're going go build a new one.
sentences.chinese: 这个图书管太旧，他们打算建一个新的。

sentences.english: The Japanese build their traditional houses on boats when land becomes too expensive.
sentences.chinese: 当土地变得很贵时，日本人便把传统房屋建在船上。

sentences.english: Who can build the tallest tower with these ingredients?
sentences.chinese: 谁能使用这些工具建出最高的塔？

sentences.english: Swim in the ocean. Plant a garden.
sentences.chinese: 在大海里面游泳，建一个花园。

sentences.english: This temple mainly adjoins the Chinese zither one of for Indian Lord to construct.
sentences.chinese: 这座庙主要为印度主神之一毗瑟挐而建。

sentences.english: Her garden is built on a slope broken into 21)tiers.
sentences.chinese: 她的花园建在一个修成好几级的斜坡上。

sentences.english: The brief was developed on a single L-shaped level.
sentences.chinese: 该建筑建在一个单一的L型的水平上。

sentences.english: it took four years to build, one year for each floor.
sentences.chinese: 它花了四年才建成，一年建一层。

sentences.english: Future plans include building a service area right in the middle of the bridge.
sentences.chinese: 计划将来会在桥中间建一个服务区。

sentences.english: I want to build myself a country house.
sentences.chinese: 我想给自己建一座乡间别墅。
